channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024040093
item.description:
Report X-2024040093

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED OUT FOR A HAZMAT LEAKER THAT WAS LOCATED AT THE IRREG LINE IR2. ONCE THE RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE, THEY GATHERED A LINED SPILL TRAY AS WELL AS DONNING ALL APPROPRIATE PPE REQUIRED FOR THE HAZMAT LEAK. RESPONDER FOLLOWED STEPS ACCORDING TO THE DECISION TREE. RESPONDER SAFELY PUT THE HAZMAT INSIDE THE LINED SPILL TRAY AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO THE RESPONDER CAGE FOR PROPER PROCCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024030592
item.description:
Report E-2024030592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately 5 gallons of UN1263 was released from one 5-gallon DM due to improper blocking and bracing. The release impacted the trailer floor. No Drains, Soils, or waterways were reported impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024030606
item.description:
Report E-2024030606

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that a 55-gallon metal drum of UN1993 Service Pro Non-Chlorinated Brake Cleaner was punctured by fallen freight causing approximately 5 oz to release on the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined terminal personnel could clean the release with the PPE available on-site.
